perturbation.original_text:
2.6 “Sponsorship Benefits” means the benefits Newegg will provide Allied, including the license granted in Section 6.1 and the fee stated
in Schedule 3.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.6 “Sponsorship Benefits” means the considerations Newegg may provide Allied, including the license granted in Section 6.1 and any potential payments outlined in Schedule 3.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Sponsorship Benefits' clearly states that it includes a fee. The modified definition uses the term 'considerations' and 'any potential payments' which implies that the fee is not guaranteed. This contradicts the initial agreement that includes the 'Sponsorship Fee' as a fixed commitment from Newegg to Allied.

perturbation.original_text:
2.7 “Sponsorship Rights” means the bundle of rights, services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg as set out in Schedule 4,
which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.7 “Sponsorship Rights” means the collection of opportunities, services, and possible deliverables Allied may provide to Newegg as generally described in Schedule 4,
which may include a license to use the Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that 'Sponsorship Rights' includes a bundle of rights, services and deliverables which Allied WILL provide, but the modified version uses terms 'collection of opportunities', 'possible deliverables' and 'may include', making the provision of Sponsorship Rights uncertain and discretionary. This contradicts Allied's defined obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
14.6 Upon termination for any reason, Newegg shall, without prejudice to its other rights, be immediately discharged of all obligations to
pay any further Sponsorship Fees not yet rendered or to provide any further Sponsorship Benefits that have not already been delivered to Allied.
Further, if Sponsorship Fees have been paid in advance, the Sponsorship Fee shall be prorated through the date of termination and Allied shall
refund the portion corresponding to the unused period of the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.6 Upon termination for any reason, Newegg shall, without prejudice to its other rights, have reduced commitments to pay any further Sponsorship Fees not yet rendered or to fully provide any further Sponsorship Benefits that have not already been fully delivered to Allied. Allied may refund a portion of previously paid Sponsorship Fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text enforces that Newegg will be 'immediately discharged of all obligations to pay any further Sponsorship Fees', but the modified version changed this term into 'reduced commitments to pay', meaning the obligations are still present, but there are just less. Furthermore, the original stated 'the Sponsorship Fee shall be prorated...and Allied shall refund', which places a legal obligation on Allied to make the refund, but the modified text changes this language into 'Allied may refund', which removed the explicit legal requirement.
